glsa.title: xv: Filename handling vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: xv contains a format string vulnerability, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: xv is an interactive image manipulation package for X11.

description.p: Tavis Ormandy of the Gentoo Linux Security Audit Team identified a flaw in the handling of image filenames by xv.

impact.p: Successful exploitation would require a victim to process a specially crafted image with a malformed filename, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All xv users should upgrade to the latest version:
